greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 2 * floor( 3/14 * n^2) if n even, a(n) = 2 * round( 3/14 * n^2) -1 if n odd.
comment: The degrees of the sequence of the G_2 polynomials defined by Bruce Westbury is conjectured to be a(n).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
B. W. Westbury, Enumeration of non-positive planar trivalent graphs, J. Algebraic Combin. 25 (2007), 357-373, arXiv:math/0507112 [math.CO], 2005.
B. W. Westbury, Finding recurrence relation for a sequence of polynomials, MathOverflow, 15 July 2010.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (2, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, -2, 1).
program: (MAGMA) m:=50; R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Integers(), m); Coefficients(R!((x^8-2*x^7-2*x^6-2*x^3-2*x^2+x)/(x^9-2*x^8+x^7-x^2+2*x-1))); // _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 08 2018
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Oct 31 2013
